intro: Phyllostegia moniliformis, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture, while its stems are hairy and somewhat woody. Phyllostegia moniliformis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas and along streambanks.
